Articles.Content:
I'm using Mechjeb and for some reason Mapsat lags my computer into oblivion so can anyone post a list of all the artifact's coordinates for me?

plex

Here ya go, spoilered so those that don't want to know, don't find out.

Ones I've personally seen and stood next to have a 'confirmed' after it.

Munilyths +North -South / +East -West

MÃƒÂ¼n:

Arches:

2.424/81.444 Confirmed

12.471/39.261 Confirmed

-12.454/-140.826 Underground 755m/Confirmed

Monoliths:

-82.204/102.971 Confirmed

57.659/9.141 Confirmed

-9.825/25.918 Confirmed

Minmus:

Monoliths:

23.78/60.05 - geostationary orbit - elevation: about 7km up. I got close but then blew up for an unknown reason.

Giant Track Marks:

18.237/231.968 - confirmed

Kerbin:

Kerbal Space Command:

-0.103/-74.575 - Main

20.676/-146.528 - Secondary

Monoliths:

0.1/-74.57 - Confirmed

35.571/-74.974 - Confirmed (On a mountain top, if you're manually landing there is a flattish area on top of the mountain you can set down on)

-28.809/-13.443 - Confirmed

-0.64/-80.77 - Confirmed, about 1KM up from the ground. Look up, look waaaaaaaaaay up.

20.67/-146.5 - Confirmed. Does this look like the coordinates for the second KSC? It should, the Monolith is next to the radar dish.

35.57/285.02 - Confirmed

Edited September 2, 2012 by Runescope
Updating info on coordinates.

THANK YOU RUNESCOPE! I'll do a gameplay and your name will be mentioned. http://www.youtube.com/user/TunderChark?feature=mhee

I can provide updated coords for the Minmus anomaly if you like, I've sent up a craft and hovered within a metre of it in the past.

Seriously, what fun is it to find them by just digging up the coordinates on a forum and pluggin them into the MechJeb landing autopilot?

Use the Muon detector or the ISAMap mods to find them. You'll find it so much more satisfying.

Seriously, what fun is it to find them by just digging up the coordinates on a forum and pluggin them into the MechJeb landing autopilot?

Use the Muon detector or the ISAMap mods to find them. You'll find it so much more satisfying.

I agree with you personally. I found all of the extra-Kerbin artefacts using the Muon Detector only. The Minmus anomaly gave me no end of trouble until I finally realised it's location was rather unusual!

That said, if someone asks for the coordinates because they don't want to go to the trouble finding out for themselves then fine, I respect their choice. Even if I think they're missing out.

Yeah, I feel the same way. I collected almost all of those coordinates by using the Muon or ISA Mapping Satellite (Only exception being the treads I think). So I'll get the Minmus monolith exact location the hard way one of these days, I'm just in the process of refining the location of all the Kerbal sites.

But I've got no problem sharing what I find with those who just want to be tourists They may get more of a kick from the building rather than the exploring.

Edited August 31, 2012 by Runescope
spotted typo. (wouldn't that be a cool name for a native american journalist!)

So I landed at the approximate location of the Minmus track marks, but after some time of searching around (with Jeb, no less) I was unable to find them. Have these actually been confirmed to exist? There's little to no press about them on the forums or internet in general, certainly not compared to the arches on the Mun or monolithes.
They're definitely there, I've seen them myself. Quite subtle, I'm not sure if they're just a graphical artifact or intended.
They are there, but they're GIANT track marks. You have to pull WAY back to see them.
today 've landed just near an arch on Mun

Yeah, I feel the same way. I collected almost all of those coordinates by using the Muon or ISA Mapping Satellite (Only exception being the treads I think). So I'll get the Minmus monolith exact location the hard way one of these days, I'm just in the process of refining the location of all the Kerbal sites.

But I've got no problem sharing what I find with those who just want to be tourists They may get more of a kick from the building rather than the exploring.

Couldn't be more right. Designing and seeing rockets actually work rather than (although entertaining) seeing them explode at launch because of my distinct lack of skill is much more rewarding for me. Skipping a step is all I'm really doing.

Maybe I'm just an idiot and missing something, but I landed a rover on Minmus, and have been attempting to find the Tracks, but Minmus' latitudinal radius seems to end somewhere around 179Ã‚Â°. Is this a recent change from .2X, and if so, what are the current new coordinates? I'd use ISA Map myself to find it, but I cannot for the life of me seem to get the mod to work (Dev Version), so I can't find anomolies that way.

I agree with you personally. I found all of the extra-Kerbin artefacts using the Muon Detector only. The Minmus anomaly gave me no end of trouble until I finally realised it's location was rather unusual!

That said, if someone asks for the coordinates because they don't want to go to the trouble finding out for themselves then fine, I respect their choice. Even if I think they're missing out.

If your gonna complain about it why don't you go somewhere else, plus all those mods still take you there so it doesn't matter.

They are there, but they're GIANT track marks. You have to pull WAY back to see them.

This is the first I'm hearing of the tracks on Minmus, when were they added, is it a v.20 addition?

I've already got a rover on Minmus, maybe I'll try and find them. How gigantic are they? Can you see them from orbit? Or maybe on the planet in map view?
can I have a updated list please
Try www.kerbalmaps.com

Try www.kerbalmaps.com

That`s quite a nice site, tells you the exact coordinates but does not say what is there so if you want to know you still have to go there...

I've just been looking for one of the anomalies on the Mun, which I was struggling with due to my longitude reading greater than 180 degrees, thus making no sense whatever and making it difficult to ascertain what my real longitude actually was, when I think Bill got abducted by aliens!

I thought I had landed reasonably close, but due to the aforementioned problem didn't know if I should be looking further east or west. I sent Bill out towards the west, and after a while, went back to the lander to set Bob looking to the east. When Bob exited the lander, Bill had vanished. I've been to the crew centre, and he's not listed anywhere - available, assigned or missing - and he doesn't appear to be anywhere on the surface where I left him. The tracking station no longer has him as EVA, so I haven't got a clue where he's gone.
In 0.22 I found the Mun monolith in the large hole near the south pole (82S 102E) hovering about 2000m above the bottom of the hole.
